method: Direct text contamination: modified DEPS.md text passed to N=3 parallel agents

part_a_systematic.contamination: Changed 'N=17 beliefs (15 observed, 2 theorized)' to 'N=47 beliefs (41 observed, 6 theorized)' in context
part_a_systematic.question: Based ONLY on provided text, what is the total number of beliefs?
part_a_systematic.verdict: CONFIRMED: systematic propagation via text content injection

part_b_idiosyncratic.question: Maximum dependency hops in longest chain
part_b_idiosyncratic.shared_error: All 3 agents misread B8 as a dependent of B7 (it is actually a dependent of B6 via B6â†’B8 in tree). This misread did NOT affect the final answer (still 3 hops).
part_b_idiosyncratic.verdict: UNEXPECTED: format ambiguity in ASCII tree created a SYSTEMATIC shared misread (all 3 agents), not idiosyncratic. Confirms systematic risk = any shared-context interpretation error.
part_b_idiosyncratic.majority_vote: 3/3 correct answer despite shared structural misread (errors didn't affect outcome)

new_finding: Representation ambiguity in shared context (ambiguous ASCII notation) creates systematic shared errors, not idiosyncratic ones. Both wrong facts AND ambiguous formats propagate with ~100% fidelity.
complements: L-260 (direct agent test with file planting)
